values.comments:
This class focuses on the theory and practice of personnel management and
human resource issues in organizations of all types. The course aims to enable managers
to understand the human aspects of his or her job and adapt this knowledge to the
efficient use of human resources. It emphasizes overall management responsibilities
relating to HR rather than the procedural aspects of personnel management.
Students found the subject area of this course to be “dry,” especially the way it
was presented in the textbook. Students felt that an inordinate amount of time was spent
on legal topics, which were especially dull. However, students also reported that this
class with be helpful because it “covered all the pertinent areas of HR.”
Overall, students found Professor Francesco to be a knowledgeable and
interesting professor. They applauded Professor Francesco’s “ability to express the
material,” and thought she was “very passionate about HR.” In addition, they thought
Professor Francesco was organized, and that her assignments were helpful in learning the
material.
Though students enjoyed Professor Francesco’s presentation of the material, they
found that the projects assigned were too time consuming to only count for 25% of the
overall grade. One student reported that the class “rarely made it through an entire
lecture, which is a shame,” and that there were several topics that were self-taught.
Students thought that this class would be worthwhile for anyone who has never had
exposure to Human Resource Management, as it covers a wealth of relevant material.
This course is part of the Wharton Program for Working Professionals.
*Based on 7 written reviews.
